newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak SAX falls to yr-low in flat trading.
newsitem.headline: Slovak SAX falls to yr-low in flat trading.

text.p: Slovak blue chips closed mixed in thin trading on the Bratislava Stock Exchange (BSE) on Wednesday, with the 16-share SAX index easing 0.85 points to a year-low of 165.77.
Two of the bourse's leading issues -- steel maker VSZ and oil refinery Slovnaft -- firmed slightly, while losses to aluminium maker ZSNP helped pull the index down.
VSZ closed higher by 10 crowns, at 640 and Slovnaft gained five crowns to 835. ZSNP closed down 61 crowns at 240.
The BSE continues to suffer from a significant lack of liquidity, as only 569 and 233 shares were traded on the BSE's listed and unlisted floors, respectively.
Brokers said they expect the current trend of listless trading to continue throughout most of the summer.

Overall, volume decreased to 246,030 shares, from 407,369 shares traded on Tuesday, while turnover fell to 52.44 million crowns, from 155.86 million. Both volume and turnover were boosted by direct trades.
